name: All-Devouring Narwhal
desc:
A mysterious and gargantuan creature from another world.

Poets often liken the starry sky to the ocean. They've seen or dreamt of countless bioluminescent plankton floating on a moonless sea, resembling a galaxy, or the moonlight ripped apart by waves on the sea's surface, like shimmering stars. In the most fantastical stories or outrageous lies, the stars found in the depths of the cosmos might be teeming with life, much like Teyvat, and the universe itself is akin to an ocean. Realistically speaking, however, if a profound universe full of life exists, why hasn't any of that life made contact with Teyvat?

Maybe the universe has been constantly trying to infiltrate Teyvat, or maybe a higher power created borders to protect this world.

dropMaterial.name: Mora
dropMaterial.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

dropMaterial.name: Lightless Silk String
dropMaterial.desc:
A slender strand that somehow ended up entangled on your weapon while fighting the All-Devouring Narwhal.

In ancient Fontaine, some thought that Fortuna, which ruled the world, was woven from countless fibers, like the strings of a harp. Strings that resonate with the majestic music would bring happiness to all, while discord would destroy the fabric of the universe.

dropMaterial.name: Lightless Eye of the Maelstrom
dropMaterial.desc:
A strange "substance" obtained from fighting against the All-Devouring Narwhal. Its actual weight far exceeds what would be expected given its size.

Everything gathers around heavy objects, just as gold attracts more than iron, or the ground more than in the breeze blowing above. Just as light cannot escape from the vortex of darkness, cause and effect is attached to fate, perhaps irreversibly so.

dropMaterial.name: Lightless Mass
dropMaterial.desc:
A fragment produced from the intense battle against the All-Devouring Narwhal.

The universe is a dark and cold place.

But look carefully. Inside are always faint glimmers of light, like pearls gleaming from within the sand, splinters of diamond sprinkled over asphalt, lights lancing through the fog on a misty night, and sparks that ignite the brightest blazes.

dropMaterial.name: Varunada Lazurite Fragment
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"My ideals have no stains."

dropMaterial.name: Varunada Lazurite Chunk
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"My ideals have no stains.
I must correct you. People here bear no sins in the eyes of the gods..."

dropMaterial.name: Varunada Lazurite Gemstone
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"My ideals have no stains.
I must correct you. People here bear no sins in the eyes of the gods... Only laws and the Tribunal can judge someone.
They can judge even me. So praise my magnificence and purity."

dropMaterial.name: Dream Solvent
dropMaterial.desc:
An item capable of changing Character Level-Up Materials obtained from memories and trials into whatever form is needed.
People once believed that spirits and memories had some material form. If someone dreamed of heaven before waking up clutching a flower, then that blossom must have been made from such a fantasy. Dream Solvent dissolves that which is obtained from memory and transforms it into some other dream.
Indeed, blows traded with the strong are stepping stones towards becoming stronger yourself.

dropMaterial.name: Midlander Sword Billet
dropMaterial.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

dropMaterial.name: Midlander Bow Billet
dropMaterial.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

dropMaterial.name: Midlander Claymore Billet
dropMaterial.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

dropMaterial.name: Midlander Catalyst Billet
dropMaterial.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

dropMaterial.name: Midlander Polearm Billet
dropMaterial.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy</color>
Enter the belly of the beast twice during a single challenge.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>Three Days and Nights in the Belly of the Great Fish</color>
Escape the belly of the beast without being hit at all by the phantasm(s) within.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

Defeat an All-Devouring Narwhal in Co-Op Mode.

Album: Pelagic Primaevality
Track: 68

<color=#ffd780>November 8, 2023</color>
Hello, Travelers!
After the Version 4.2 update, Travelers will encounter a new enemy All-Devouring Narwhal. Let's check out what special traits it has and how to deal with it~

value.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
value.desc:
Cryptic Creature: All-Devouring Narwhal

In the most fantastical of fables, or perhaps in the most rabid of ravings, the true stars in the depths of cosmos are just as full of life as on Teyvat, while the universe itself is akin to an ocean.

Perhaps the universe's infiltration of Teyvat has never ceased, and perhaps the drawing of borders around this world was the work of a higher will, meant to protect it.
